ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is a seminar bioethics class that covers important topics regarding research ethics, lab dynamics, and neuroethics. I would highly recommend the course to a graduate student who has not taken an ethics course before and I would make it mandatory for any undergraduate science students.
I would recommend the course. Very light work load and covers a lot of interesting bioethics topics.
Yes, it was one of my favorite classes.
It's required, but you'll enjoy it.
A thought-provoking and also practical course about many aspects of neuroscience research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel more aware of the challenges that scientist face and tools to deal with them.
The topics were very relevant to my research (e.g. working with humans and animals, lab conflict issues, societal impact of neuroscience research).

I got to think about and discuss topics that I would not otherwise have put much time into. I think it was useful to give us a survey of ethical topics. The final essay was also a good chance to explore further.
It allowed me to explore ethical issues within the field.
It provides helpful introduction to process and meaning of research.
